children.name: bring sth to sb’s attention
children.definition: bring sb to sb’s attention/notice to tell sb about sth that they did not know but which they should know:cho ai đó biết cái gì
examples: I am sure that your parents will want to know about this, and I will personally bring it to their attention.
The General Medical Council cannot investigate every controversial treatment brought to its attention.

children.name: it’s been brought to my attention/ notice thattôi đã được biết rằng
examples: It’s been brought to my notice that you’ve expressed your dislike of a certain member of the company.

children.name: let sb know
children.definition: especially spoken to tell someone something important that they need to know or want to know: nói cho ai đó biết
examples: ▪ If you need any help, just let me know.
▪ You mean she just left without letting anyone know?

children.name: let sb know about
examples: ▪ They said they’d let her know about the job by the end of the week.

children.name: let sb know sth
examples: ▪ I’ll let you know our new address as soon as I have it.

children.name: let sb know (that)
examples: ▪ When you get there, will you phone and let me know you arrived safely?

children.name: let sb know what/where/how etc
examples: ▪ Jean tried to get in touch with her husband to let him know what had happened.

children.name: break the news
children.definition: (to sb)/ break it to sb to tell sb some bad news or sth that might upset them: báo tin xấu
examples: Do you want to break the news or shall I?
She suspected that she had cancer, and that the doctors were trying to break it to her gradually.
After Jack’s body was found, a policewoman had to break the news to his mother.
I didn't want to be the one to break the news to him.

children.name: break it to sb that
examples: He was wondering how to break it to Celeste that their relationship was over.

children.name: break the news gently/ break it to sb gentlytell sb sth in a way that does not shock them too much
examples: Maybe I should speak to Connor first, so he can break the news gently to Patrick and Mary.
Come on, what happened? Break it to megently(= in a kind way) .

children.name: tell
children.definition: /tel/  nói
examples: ▪ If you’d told me earlier I might have been able to do something about it.

children.name: tell sb sth
examples: ▪ I want you to tell me all the details.
▪ Who on earth told you that?
▪ Can you tell me the quickest way to the centre of town?

children.name: tell sb (that)
examples: ▪ She wrote to tell me she was getting married.
▪ We were told that the manager wanted to see us in his office immediately.

children.name: tell somebody what/where/who etc nói với ai đó cái gì, ở đâu, ai
examples: ▪ Just tell me what happened.
▪ Can you tell us where the nearest garage is?

children.name: tell somebody about something nói với ai đó về cái gì
examples: ▪ Have you told anyone about this?
▪ One angry passenger claimed travellers were not told about the mechanical problems.

children.name: to tell sb the most recent info
keep sb informed
children.definition: to give someone regular information about decisions, events etc, so that they know exactly what is happening: báo cho ai đó tin mới nhất
examples: I want to know what you decide, so keep me informed.

children.name: keep sb fully/well informed
examples: During the strike, the media kept the public fully informed about the situation.
Parents have complained that we are not keeping them very well informed of their children’s progress.

children.name: keep sb informed of/about
examples: We’ll be keeping you informed of any new developments.
The doctor should be kept informed about any changes in your child’s condition.

children.name: keep sb up to date
children.definition: to give sb regular information about what has been happening most recently: báo cho ai đó tin mới nhất
examples: We publish a weekly newsletter to keep everyone up to date.
keep sb up to date with/on
She reads the newspaper every day to keep herself up to date with financial affairs
the magazine that keeps you up to date on all the latest in rock and pop

children.name: fill in
children.definition: fill sb in to tell sb about things that have happened recently, which they do not know about because they have not talked to you for quite a long time or they have been somewhere else: cho ai biết, cho ai thông tin
examples: You didn’t miss much - I’ll fill you in later
fill sb in on
Marjorie filled us in on all the latest gossip
Please can someone fill me in on anything I’ve missed?
fill sb in on what/where/when etc
Bob filled me in on what he had been doing since we last met.

children.name: brief
children.definition: /briːf/  to give sb all the necessary information about a situation, so that they know exactly what is happening or so that they are prepared for something that they have to do: tường thuật
examples: ▪ Police officers were briefed before going out to arrest the suspects.
briefing[countable noun] bản tường thuật
▪ The drug squad’s briefing lasted twenty minutes.

children.name: be fully/well briefed tường thuật đầy đủ
examples: ▪ Make sure that the PR department are fully briefed on their role.
▪ It was clear the witness had been well briefed.

children.name: brief somebody on/about something tường thuật cho ai đó về cái gì
examples: ▪ You’ll be picked up from here tomorrow night and briefed on what you have to do.
▪ DeGaulle flew back to England to be briefed about the invasion that was about to begin.

children.name: give sb the low-down
children.definition: informal to tell someone all the information they need to know about a situation: nói cho ai biết sự thật
examples: ▪ ‘Have you heard about the deal with IBM?’ ‘Yes, John’s just been giving me the low-down.’
give sb the low-down on
▪ The travel reporter was giving the low-down on the evening’s traffic chaos.

children.name: give sb an update
children.definition: on to tell sb the things that have happened concerning a particular piece of work, plan, or situation since they last saw you: cập nhật cho ai đó biết về
examples: Let me give you an update on the trial.
Can you give me an update on any policy changes there’ve been since we last spoke?
Jo's just doing an updateonthe mailing list.
I'll need regular updatesonyour progress.

children.name: report
children.definition: to officially tell someone about what has been happening in a particular area of work, especially because it is your job to do so:báo cáo
examples: Is there anything to report?

children.name: report to sb on sth
examples: Nicky reports to me on any new developments in the relevant technological fields.

children.name: report back (to sb)
examples: The delegation will report back to Congress on the situation inside China.

children.name: keep sb posted
children.definition: spokento regularly tell someone the most recent news about

children.name: keep sb posted on
examples: I’ll keep you posted on his progress.
Keep me postedonanything that happens while I'm away.

children.name: update
children.definition: spokento tell someone the most recent information about a situation :cập nhật cho

children.name: update sb on sth
examples: We'll update you on this news story throughout the day.
Can you update me on what’s been happening?

children.name: to tell sb sth that sb else has told you
pass on
children.definition: to give someone amessageor someinformationthat another person hasaskedyou to give:chuyển lời

children.name: pass on sth (to sb)
examples: Could you pass on my thanks for all these lovely gifts?
Please pass on my sympathy to Mr and Mrs Stanton.

children.name: pass sth on (to sb)
examples: She said she’d pass the message on to the other students.
I’m grateful for everything that has been said today, and I will be sure to pass it on.
If he provided us with any information, no one passed it ontome.

children.name: relay
children.definition: to send or give sb anofficialmessage, a piece of news, information etc which you have received from another person :chuyển tiếp
examples: Mendoza relayed the news as soon as he returned to the base.

children.name: relay to
examples: The speaker opened the session by relaying some messages to the conference.

children.name: ways of asking sb to tell you sth
tell me
children.definition: /ˈtel miː/ spoken:
examples: ▪ Tell me Caroline, do you trust me?

children.name: tell me where/when/how etc
examples: ▪ Tell me where you left the money.
▪ Come in and tell me what the problem is.

children.name: tell me about
examples: ▪ Tell me about Thursday night. Did you visit Mrs Berry?

children.name: tell me sth
examples: ▪ Tell me a little about yourself.

children.name: out with it
children.definition: / spit it outspoken say this when you are annoyed or angry because sb has not told you sth: nói đi, muốn nói gì nói đi
examples: ▪ I know there’s sth you’re not telling us, so out with it!
▪ His name, Cathy, his name! Out with it!
▪ What have you done? Come on -- spit it out!
▪ Are you implying something? Spit it out then!

children.name: when a book, notice etc gives info
tell
children.definition: /tel/  nói

children.name: tell sb how/what/where etc
examples: ▪ This leaflet tells you how to apply for a driving licence.

children.name: tell sb sth
examples: ▪ The two dials in the middle tell you the airspeed and altitude.

children.name: tell sb (that)
examples: ▪ A sign told us it was the highest village in England.

children.name: give
children.definition: to provide information or details about sth: đưa ra

children.name: give information/details/instructions etc
examples: ▪ The handbook gave full instructions on how to change the oil.
▪ LA Weekly magazine gives information about what’s on in Los Angeles every week.

children.name: give an account/description/report
examples: ▪ The article gave a vivid account of life after the earthquake.

children.name: give sb information/details etc
examples: ▪ The footprint could give police crucial details about the man’s shoe size and probable weight and size.

children.name: say
children.definition: to give a particular piece of information about sth: viết

children.name: say sth about sth
examples: What does the guidebook say about the Opera House?

children.name: it says here (that)it is written here that nó được viết ở đây rằng
examples: It says here that the police are closing in on the killer.

children.name: to let sb know sth indirectly
give sb to understand
children.definition: (that) formal to make sb think that something is true, or that something will happen, but without actually saying this clearly: khiến ai đó nghĩ rằng

children.name: A friend of your daughter’s gave us to understand that you lived in Michigan
examples: Although I received no official indication, I was given to understand that I would be promoted within a year.

children.name: not in so many words
children.definition: if sb lets you know sth shocking, bad, or unkind, but not in so many words, they let you know that it is true without saying it directly: không nói thẳng ra
examples: ‘Did Sarah tell you she was leaving?’ ‘Not in so many words, no.’

children.name: make sth known
children.definition: to let sb know sth without telling them directly, for example by behaving in a particular way or by telling sb else who you know will then tell the person:
examples: The Queen made her displeasure known by cancelling her visit.

children.name: make your feelings/views/wishes known
examples: ▪ People without the right to vote were often able to make their feelings known through demonstrations or riots.

children.name: make it known that
examples: ▪ The other boys in Steven’s class took every opportunity to make it known that he was not accepted.

children.name: official
children.definition: adjective

children.name: If a piece of information is official, it has been announced publicly with authority
examples: _Their engagement is now official.
_Inflation has fallen below 2%, and that's official.

children.name: by/from all accounts
children.definition: as said by most people
examples: _By all accounts,San Franciscois a city that's easy to fall in love with.

children.name: declare
children.definition: verbEXPRESS khai (hàng hoá để đóng thuế)

children.name: give
children.definition: verbgave,givenPROVIDE rao;công bố

children.name: notify
children.definition: formal to officially or formally give important information to sb, especially by telling them about sth that has happened or that will happen: thông báo, báo cáo
examples: Passengers are requested to notify a member of staff if they see suspicious packages.

children.name: notify sb of sth
examples: Police notified the boy’s parents of his death immediately.

children.name: notify sb that
examples: Staff were notified several months in advance that they would be losing their jobs.

children.name: inform
children.definition: to officially or formally give sb information about sth: thông báo, báo
examples: Do you think we ought to inform the police?
They decided to inform the police
inform sb about/of sth
Please inform us of any change of address as soon as possible.
You should inform your bank of any change of address.
Doctors should inform patients about the possible side effects of any drugs they prescribe.
inform sb (that)
We regret to inform you that your application has been rejected.

children.name: misinform
children.definition: to tell sb information that is not correct : báo tin tức sai

children.name: be misinformed
examples: I was told she would be at the meeting, but clearly I was misinformed.
I am afraid you’ve been misinformed.
